HDRIBackdropVisualizationTool.Description: A Blueprint tool for quick product visualization using HDR image projection with real-time lighting and shadowing.

Benefits.ShadowCatcher: Includes a fake ground plane for consistent shadow catching.

Steps: Open your project in Unreal Editor.
Click Edit in the Main menu and select Plugins.
Under Rendering, enable HDRI Backdrop Plugin.
Restart the project to apply changes.
Import a spherical HDR image using the Content Browser.
Set appropriate Maximum Texture Size and Mip Gen Settings in the Texture Editor.
Create a New Level and select Empty Level.
Drag HDRI Backdrop asset into the Level Viewport.
Configure settings in the Details panel.
Optionally, add a Light Source and set it to Movable.

Settings: Maximum Texture Size to match larger resolution value

SunAndSkyActor.Description: A tool providing a geographically accurate time of day system for location, date, and time.

Templates.Description: For architecture visualization with examples for sun studies and interior rendering.

Settings: Enable Extend default luminance range in Auto Exposure settings

Steps: Open Unreal Editor and go to Edit > Plugins.
Enable Sun Position Calculator Plugin under the Misc category.
Restart the project.
Find Sun and Sky Actor in the Lights tab.
Drag it into the Level viewport.
Remove existing Directional Light, Sky Light, or SkyAtmosphere components.
Enable Extend default luminance range in Auto Exposure settings in Project Settings under Rendering category.
Alternatively, lower Lux intensity of Directional Light in the SunSky Actor.

Location.Latitude: Degree north or south of the equator.
Location.Longitude: Degree east or west of the prime meridian.
Location.TimeZone: Time zone using GMT as a basis.

Time.SolarTime: Time of day in military time (e.g., 12:30 AM is 00.5, 12:30 PM is 12.5).

Exterior.Description: Demonstrates SunSky Actor with multiple cameras and time-of-day sequence.

Interior.Description: Uses SunSky Actor components with precomputed static lighting.

AdditionalNotes.RayTracingFeatures: Enabled by default for Directional Light and Sky Light.
AdditionalNotes.RotationalValues: Manually changing rotational values will reset with other setting changes.
AdditionalNotes.RealTimeCapture: Enabled by default for SkyLight Actors.

GeographicallyAccurateSunPositioningTool.Description: A tool for precise control over the Sun's position based on geographic location, date, and time.
GeographicallyAccurateSunPositioningTool.Context: Critical for true-to-life renderings in architecture and construction projects.
GeographicallyAccurateSunPositioningTool.Functionality: Places the Sun in Unreal Engine Level using mathematical equations for realistic sunlight and shadow patterns.

Setup.Prerequisite: Ensure Level contains a BP_SkySphere instance.

Steps.Description: From main menu, choose Edit > Plugins and enable Sun Position Calculator under Misc category. Restart Unreal Editor.
In Content Browser, enable Show Engine Content and Show Plugin Content.
Find BP_SunPosition Asset in SunPosition Content folder and drag it into the Viewport.
Select BP_SunPosition Actor and set properties in Details panel.

Location.Latitude: Use negative values for coordinates South of equator, positive for North.
Location.Longitude: Use negative values for coordinates West of meridian, positive for East.
Location.TimeZone: Offset from UTC or GMT in hours.
Location.NorthOffset: Controls relation between Level objects and cardinal points.

Properties.DateAndTime: Set the time of year and time of day to simulate.

Steps.Description: Make main Directional Light in Level Movable.
Use Get All Actors of Class node to get BP_SunPosition Actor reference and save to a variable.
Use Get and Set nodes to change values and invoke Update Sun node.

RuntimeModifications.Example: UI slider to change hour between 6am and 10pm.

HowItWorks.ConeIntersection: Compute soft area shadows and sky occlusion.

Quality.Adjustment: Increase resolution to capture important features, affecting memory footprint.

GlobalDistanceField.Description: Low-resolution Distance Field using Signed Distance Fields occlusion following the camera.

Foliage.TwoSidedDistanceField: For high-density meshes like trees with masked material surfaces.
Foliage.FoliageToolSettings: Enable Affect Distance Field Lighting for selected foliage types.

Steps.Description: Click Edit on Main menu, select Project Settings.
Under Engine > Rendering, toggle Generate Mesh Distance Fields.
Restart the project.

Features.DynamicAO: Supports dynamic scene changes; occlusion is computed from world-space occluders.
Features.SignedDistanceFieldVolumes: Precomputed around rigid meshes for medium scale Ambient Occlusion.

Setup.Prerequisite: Enable Generate Mesh Distance Fields in Project Settings.
Steps: Drag a Sky Light into the scene and set its Mobility to Movable.

SkyLightSettings.Visualization: Show > Visualize > Distance Fields Ambient Occlusion

Steps: Enable Affect Distance Field Lighting in the Foliage Tool settings.
Enable Two-Sided Distance Field Generation for foliage type assets.
Foliage.Issues: Foliage LODs can cause over-occlusion; use World Position Offset and Pixel Depth Offset to mitigate.

UsingDistanceFieldShadows.Description: How to set up and use Distance Field Shadowing for dynamic lighting in games.

Benefits.DynamicLighting: Ideal for long view distances or large open worlds.
Benefits.Efficiency: Shadows at farther distances than traditional Cascaded Shadow Maps (CSM) with Directional Light.

SetupSteps.Prerequisite: Enable Generate Mesh Distance Fields in Project Settings (Rendering section).

Steps.Description: Navigate to Place Actors panel, select and drag a Directional, Spot, or Point Light into the main viewport.
Select the Light, go to its Details panel, and set its Mobility to Movable or Stationary.
In the Details panel under Distance Field Shadows, enable Distance Field Shadows.

SetupSteps.Note: If the option is grayed out, ensure Generate Mesh Distance Fields is enabled in Project Settings and the light's Mobility is set to Movable or Stationary.

EndResult.Description: Once set to Movable or Stationary and Distance Field Shadowing is enabled, the light will automatically use them for the level.
EndResult.DirectionalLights: Distance Field Shadowing enabled for any distance beyond the Cascaded Shadow Maps Dynamic Shadow Distance value.

Comparison.CSMandDFS: Cascaded Shadow Maps and Distance Field Shadows

AdditionalSettings.Description: Refer to the Distance Field Reference for settings specific to Directional Lights and Point/Spot Lights.
Benefits: Artistic control over shadow softness and distance.
Global adjustments to remove self-shadowing artifacts from LOD meshes at farther distances.

UsingDistanceFieldAmbientOcclusion.Description: How to set up and use Distance Field Ambient Occlusion (DFAO) for dynamic Ambient Occlusion in games.

Benefits.DynamicAO: Uses Mesh Distance Fields for movable Static Meshes, not limited to screen space or precomputed lighting.

SetupSteps.Prerequisite: Enable Generate Mesh Distance Fields in Project Settings (Rendering section).

Steps.Description: Navigate to Place Actors panel, select and drag a Sky Light into the Level Viewport.
Select the Sky Light, go to its Details panel, and set its Mobility to Movable.

EndResult.Description: Once the Sky Light is set to Movable, DFAO will be automatically enabled for your level.

Comparison.WithoutDFAO: Sky Light without Distance Field Ambient Occlusion
Comparison.WithDFAO: Sky Light with Distance Field Ambient Occlusion

AdditionalSettings.Description: Refer to the Distance Field Reference for settings specific to DFAO for Sky Lights.

UsingDistanceFieldIndirectShadows.Description: How to set up and use Distance Field Indirect Shadows (DFIS) for area shadowing in indirectly lit areas.

Benefits.DynamicShadowing: Provides soft area shadowing for movable objects in indirectly lit areas.
Benefits.Integration: Blends dynamic objects with precomputed lighting without complex material setups or decals.

SetupSteps.Note: DFIS does not require Generate Mesh Distance Fields to be enabled for the entire project.

Steps.Description: In the Content Browser, select a Static Mesh asset and open the Static Mesh Editor.
In the Static Mesh Editor, navigate to the Details panel and enable Generate Mesh Distance Fields in the Static Mesh Settings section. Save and close the editor.
From the Content Browser, drag the mesh into the Level Viewport.
Select the Actor in the Level, go to the Details panel, and set its Mobility to Movable.
Under the Lighting tab, enable Distance Field Indirect Shadow.
If lighting hasn't been built, click Build on the Main menu and select Build Lighting Only.

EndResult.Description: Movable Static Meshes cast soft shadows in indirectly lit areas.
EndResult.Note: Indirect shadows will be minimal in directly lit or brightly lit areas.

AdditionalSettings.Description: Refer to the Distance Fields Reference for settings specific to Distance Field Indirect Shadows for Static Mesh Actors.
